seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER system procedure

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER system procedure

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER</codeph> system procedure removes a user account from a database.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER</codeph> system procedure removes a user account from a database.

target.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER</codeph> system procedure removes a user account from a database.

seg-source.mrk: NATIVE authentication

target.mrk: NATIVE authentication

seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER system procedure

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER system procedure

trans-unit.source: This procedure is used in conjunction with NATIVE authentication. For details about NATIVE authentication, see derby.authentication.provider and "Using NATIVE authentication" in the .

seg-source.mrk: This procedure is used in conjunction with NATIVE authentication.
For details about NATIVE authentication, see derby.authentication.provider and "Using NATIVE authentication" in the .

target.mrk: This procedure is used in conjunction with NATIVE authentication.
For details about NATIVE authentication, see derby.authentication.provider and "Using NATIVE authentication" in the .

trans-unit.source: You are not allowed to remove the user account of the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref>.

seg-source.mrk: You are not allowed to remove the user account of the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref>.

target.mrk: You are not allowed to remove the user account of the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref>.

trans-unit.source: If you use this procedure to remove a user account, the schemas and data objects owned by the user remain in the database and can be accessed only by the database owner or by other users who have been granted access to them. If the user is created again, the user regains access to the schemas and data objects.

seg-source.mrk: If you use this procedure to remove a user account, the schemas and data objects owned by the user remain in the database and can be accessed only by the database owner or by other users who have been granted access to them.
If the user is created again, the user regains access to the schemas and data objects.

target.mrk: If you use this procedure to remove a user account, the schemas and data objects owned by the user remain in the database and can be accessed only by the database owner or by other users who have been granted access to them.
If the user is created again, the user regains access to the schemas and data objects.

seg-source.mrk: Syntax

target.mrk: Syntax

seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER(IN USERNAME VARCHAR(128))

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER(IN USERNAME VARCHAR(128))

trans-unit.source: No result set is returned by this procedure.

seg-source.mrk: No result set is returned by this procedure.

target.mrk: No result set is returned by this procedure.

seg-source.mrk: USERNAME

target.mrk: USERNAME

trans-unit.source: A user name that is case-sensitive if you place the name string in double quotes. This user name is an authorization identifier. See "Authorization identifiers, user authentication, and user authorization" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information about how these names are treated. If the user name is that of the database owner, an error is raised.

seg-source.mrk: A user name that is case-sensitive if you place the name string in double quotes.
This user name is an authorization identifier.
See "Authorization identifiers, user authentication, and user authorization" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information about how these names are treated.
If the user name is that of the database owner, an error is raised.

target.mrk: A user name that is case-sensitive if you place the name string in double quotes.
This user name is an authorization identifier.
See "Authorization identifiers, user authentication, and user authorization" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information about how these names are treated.
If the user name is that of the database owner, an error is raised.

seg-source.mrk: Execute privileges

target.mrk: Execute privileges

trans-unit.source: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default. See "Using NATIVE authentication," "Enabling user authentication," and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information. The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Using NATIVE authentication," "Enabling user authentication," and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

target.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Using NATIVE authentication," "Enabling user authentication," and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: JDBC example

target.mrk: JDBC example

seg-source.mrk: Drop a user named FRED:

target.mrk: Drop a user named FRED:

trans-unit.source: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER('fred')"); cs.execute(); cs.close();

seg-source.mrk: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER('fred')"); cs.execute(); cs.close();

target.mrk: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER('fred')"); cs.execute(); cs.close();
